column1: The fiery steed of Colonel Bob reared and plunged
column2: as if eager to dash upon the foe. The roll of the drum made a fearful sound. The standard-bearer waved his flag. The army came rushing on. Snap the dog barked furiously. But above all the din was heard the shout of Colonel Bob
column4: my brave boys!"Not a picture started from its frame. Not a chair moved. But all of a sudden the door opened
column5: and a face looked in. It was Colonel Bob's papa."What's all this noise about
column6: Robert?" said he. "This is not the place for such games. Go out of doors if you want to play soldier. I can't have such a drumming and shouting in the house."This was rather a damper on Colonel Bob's military zeal; but what came next was still worse.
